intro: Erythranthe grayi, commonly known as Gray's monkeyflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Erythranthe grayi is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
